definition: "Denn" is a conjunction commonly used to introduce a reason or cause in a sentence. It is often employed to connect two clauses, indicating a cause-and-effect relationship or providing an explanation. Additionally, "denn" can be used to express surprise or disbelief when used in a rhetorical question.

examples.german: Ich gehe einkaufen, denn ich brauche Lebensmittel.
examples.english: I am going shopping, because I need groceries.

examples.german: Ich kann nicht kommen, denn ich habe keine Zeit.
examples.english: I can't come, because I don't have time.

examples.german: Ich habe Hunger, denn ich habe den ganzen Tag nichts gegessen.
examples.english: I am hungry, because I haven't eaten anything all day.
